name: 文法與修辭
comment: 建議修習輔系第一年時選修
goals: understand how English grammar works and feel more confident about helping your peers and/or ESL students use English accurately, meaningfully, and appropriately
identify and correct grammatical errors in spoken and written English and provide grammar explanations with commonly used terminology
explain how a word is used appropriately and how related words are distinguished
syllabus:
教學目標

This course will give an overview of the major features of English grammar. It will **not** cover **all** grammatical features in English, but rather aim at initiating independent thinking and research on the **problematic** areas of English grammar. You will become familiar with the intricacies of English grammar, particularly those that tend to be challenging to nonnative speakers. In this course you will learn to describe how English sentences are constructed and you will develop the skills necessary to analyze and explain English words, phrases and sentences, as well as learn the terminology to talk about them. In addition, you will also learn how to use the rhetorical patterns in writing for the purpose of clarity and effectiveness. 

教材大綱（含每週教學主題）

Week 1 Adjusted Holiday (No class)

Week 2 Orientation

Week 3-5  Tense/aspect

Week 6-7  Passives

Week 8 Mid-term

Week 9 Rhetorical skills

Week 10 Sports Day (No class)

Week 11-12 Conditional clauses

Week 13-14 Relative clauses

Week 15 Wrap-up and question discussion

Week 16  Final exam
